questions.prompt: How many different ways can you arrange 5 distinct books on a shelf?
questions.explanation: The number of permutations of 5 distinct objects is 5! = 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1 = 120.

questions.prompt: How many ways can you choose 3 students from a class of 10 to form a committee?
questions.explanation: This is C(10,3) = 10!/(3! × 7!) = 120. Order does not matter for committees.

questions.prompt: The pigeonhole principle states that if n items are placed into m containers where n > m, at least one container must contain more than one item.
questions.explanation: This is the correct statement of the pigeonhole principle.

questions.prompt: The formula for combinations C(n,k) is n! / (k! × ____!).
questions.explanation: C(n,k) = n! / (k! × (n-k)!), representing choosing k items from n.

questions.prompt: A password consists of 3 uppercase letters followed by 2 digits. How many passwords are possible?
What is P(5,3), the number of permutations of 5 items taken 3 at a time? Answer: ____
How many ways can the letters in "MISSISSIPPI" be arranged?
questions.explanation: 11!/(4!×4!×2!) = 39916800/(24×24×2) = 34650. Divide by factorials of repeated letters.

questions.prompt: The number of subsets of a set with n elements is 2^n.
questions.explanation: Each element has 2 choices (in or out), so 2^n total subsets including empty set.

questions.prompt: How many paths exist from (0,0) to (3,2) moving only right or up?
questions.explanation: C(3+2, 2) = C(5,2) = 10. We choose 2 of 5 moves to be "up".

questions.prompt: Using inclusion-exclusion, how many integers from 1-100 are divisible by 2 or 3?
How many ways can 5 identical balls be distributed into 3 distinct boxes?
The number of derangements D(3) (permutations with no fixed points) is ____.
In any group of 13 people, at least two must share the same birth month.
questions.explanation: Pigeonhole: 13 people into 12 months means at least one month has ⌈13/12⌉ = 2 people.

questions.prompt: The number of binary strings of length 6 with exactly 3 ones is:
questions.explanation: C(6,3) = 20. Choose 3 positions for the ones.
